meanings.definition: The act of converting back to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the factory closed down, the reconversion of the building into a community center began.
meanings.sent2: The reconversion of the old warehouse into a modern office space was a huge success.
meanings.sent3: The reconversion of the abandoned train station into a restaurant brought new life to the area.
meanings.sent4: Her reconversion from a shy introvert to a confident speaker was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The reconversion of the garden from a wild jungle to a peaceful retreat was a labor of love.

meanings.definition: The process of changing something into a different form or purpose again.
meanings.sent1: The reconversion of the spare room into a home gym was a great idea.
meanings.sent2: The reconversion of the old car into an electric vehicle saved a lot of money on fuel.
meanings.sent3: The reconversion of the cake into cake pops made them easier to share at the party.
meanings.sent4: His reconversion of the plain text into a colorful infographic made the information more engaging.
meanings.sent5: The reconversion of the traditional recipe into a vegan version was a hit with the whole family.
